Title: Principal Data Scientist
JD:
About the job
    


Requisition ID: 66442

 NextEra Energy Resources  is the world's largest generator of renewable energy from the wind and sun, and a world leader in battery storage. We provide energy-related products and services that grow our economy, protect the environment, support our communities and help customers meet their energy needs. We are leading the decarbonization of the U.S. economy with our goal to reach Real Zero carbon emissions from our operations by 2045 while improving customer affordability and reliability. Are you interested in creating a cleaner environment for future generations? Join our world-class, innovative team today.

Position Specific Description

NEER IT’s NextGen data team is looking for a principal solutions architect with strong knowledge of data science domain skills and architectural principles. Employees in this role use their expertise of machine learning, model optimization, statistics, and applied mathematics along with abilities in software engineering to deliver solutions and act as team’s consultant.

Overview

This role will be responsible for defining the overall structure of a solution. The successful candidate must have full working knowledge of data technologies A strong candidate would be focused on delivering end-to-end solution for NEER IT supported businesses. This role will collaborate with other data scientists, including technical and non-technical staff, and act as team leader.

Essential Skills
 Deliver high quality architecture solutions for large multi-generational programs spanning one or more NEER business domains Adhere to and help create data science machine learning principles and standards based on the industry best practices Create and maintain the target solution architecture and blueprints Maintain reference architecture and defines shared application components, platforms, interfaces, and development tools Solicit technical requirements and recommend appropriate technical architecture to satisfy those Develop data science models and algorithms best suited to a particular scenario A self-starter with high bias for action Assessing the effectiveness of ML models Using different data gathering and model classification techniques Keep up to date with the latest technology trends Develop processes and/or tools to monitor model performance and accuracy Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis The ability to partner with business processes to identify focus areas and improvement opportunities Establishing and managing effective customer relationships with all business partners Building strong knowledge of the technical solution being delivered, and analyzing and determining failure points
Desired Technical Skills & Experiences
 7+ years’ experience as a data scientist PhD or master’s degree in engineering or data science or data analytics field Experience in developing Data Architecture Experience in developing solution architecture Able to define and produce roadmaps to deliver and deploy end-to-end solution 5+ years of related work experience in a technical architecture, development lead, and/or technical/systems analyst role. Knowledge of Amazon Web Services Knowledge of Python, Sagemaker, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Plotly, and ML Frameworks (Tensorflow, PyTorch) Knowledge of Machine Learning and Deep learning techniques Knowledge of Computer Vision is desired Knowledge of Natural Language Processing is desired
Job Overview

This position is responsible for leading the development of algorithms, modeling techniques, and optimization methods that support many aspects of NextEra and FPL business. Employees in this role use knowledge of machine learning, optimization, statistics, and applied mathematics along with abilities in software engineering with a focus on distributed computing and data storage infrastructure (i.e., “Big Data”).

Job Duties & Responsibilities
Provide thought leadership, set technical strategy, and identify possible uses of data science methodsExplain methods and results to upper-level executivesDevelop machine learning, optimizations or other modeling solutionsOversee related employee work, learn new techniques being developedPrepares comprehensive documented observations, analyses and interpretations of results including technical reports, summaries, protocols and quantitative analysesWorks with big data and distributed computing platformsDevelops software and contributes to product developmentPerforms other job-related duties as assigned
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s DegreeExperience: 6+ years
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s DegreeDoctoral Degree
Employee Group: Exempt

Employee Type: Full Time

Job Category: Science, Research, and Technology

Organization: NextEra Energy Resources, LLC

Relocation Provided: Yes, if applicable

Where permitted by applicable law, NextEra Energy requires all employees and new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccination on or before the first day of employment.

NextEra Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, age, national origin, religion, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetics, disability, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.

NextEra Energy and provides reasonable accommodation in its application and selection process for qualified individuals, including accommodations related to compliance with conditional job offer requirements, consistent with federal, state, and local laws. Supporting medical or religious documentation will be required where applicable and permitted by applicable law. To request a reasonable accommodation, please send an e-mail to recruiting-coordinator.sharedmailbox@nexteraenergy.com , providing your name, telephone number and the best time for us to reach you. Alternatively, you may call 1-844-694-4748. Please do not use this line to inquire about your application status.

Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Senior Business Analyst - Commercial Credit & Collections Data Analyst at Landry's
Title: Senior Business Analyst - Commercial Credit & Collections Data Analyst
JD:
About the job
    


Requisition ID: 66800

 NextEra Energy Resources  is the world's largest generator of renewable energy from the wind and sun, and a world leader in battery storage. We provide energy-related products and services that grow our economy, protect the environment, support our communities and help customers meet their energy needs. We are leading the decarbonization of the U.S. economy with our goal to reach Real Zero carbon emissions from our operations by 2045 while improving customer affordability and reliability. Are you interested in creating a cleaner environment for future generations? Join our world-class, innovative team today.

Position Specific Description

 The Senior Business Analyst – Commercial Credit & Collections Data Analyst  position will provide critical analytical support and initiative project management for Commercial Credit and Collections for all NextEra Retail Brands. This individual will also support the completion of ad hoc analyses involving credit and fraud trends and operational metrics, along with provide critical insights into trends driving bad debt and performance of vendors. This individual will partner with cross functional teams to assume the following responsibilities.

Major Duties And Responsibilities
 Development of models, analysis and report publication for tracking and managing bad debt accrual vs. actual and analyzing drivers of debt for various commercial business segments.  Standardize operational metrics and KPI reporting to advanced dashboard/KPI visualization for commercial business segments  Work cross functionally with business operational partners and other departments to use findings to improve process for both financial benefit, debt reduction and gain of operational efficiency  Act as project manager for both departmental initiatives and companywide initiatives impacting Credit, Collections and Bad Debt, including billing system migration, enrollment project and various process improvement and identified automation needs.  Identify and implement process improvements to reduce redundancy in reporting efforts, improve efficiency in reviewing and processing deductions  Provide feedback that may lead to additional requests of system enhancements to reporting needs, ensuring that the requests are completed and implemented in a timely manner  Proven ability to remain organized in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects  Analyst is expected to perform other duties as necessary to support the goals and objectives of the organization 
The individual in this role must have a demonstrated track record of meeting deadlines, a willingness to take on new challenges and high comfort level in interacting with cross-functional teams and leaders.

Key Skills Include
 Database query skills in SQL  Analytics and visualization skills including PowerBI, Tableau, Python or similar  Business Process Mapping Skills using Visio  Strong business requirements documentation skills  Project Management experience with project management training preferred  Firm understanding of Six Sigma practices with a strong preference to be minimally certified as a Yellow Belt with willingness to certify higher  Business Process Improvement and Process Design  Retail Electricity, Electricity markets experience strongly preferred (ERCOT, PJM, MISO, NYISO, NEPOOL, etc)  Experience in Credit, Collections and Bad Debt analytics  Knowledge of commercial bankruptcy and AR management a plus 
Job Overview

Employees in this role conduct complex operational analyses and lead medium to large project teams that support informed decision making within the business unit.

Job Duties & Responsibilities
Conducts analyses and prepares reports that provide operational and/or technical support to business operationsConducts quantitative and qualitative research to support small to medium special projectsAssists with process design and modification for continuous business improvementPerforms other job-related duties as assigned
Required Qualifications
High School Grad / GEDBachelor's or Equivalent ExperienceExperience: 4+ years
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
Employee Group: Exempt

Employee Type: Full Time

Job Category: Finance, Accounting & Business Analytics

Organization: Gexa Energy LP

Relocation Provided: Yes, if applicable
